revised_title: The Direct Action of Cobra Venom on Blood Vessels and Heart Muscles
tldr: The study investigates the direct effects of cobra venom on blood vessels and heart muscles, revealing that it constricts arterioles, affects isolated frog and mammalian hearts, and paralyzes the respiratory center. The research also highlights the dangers of using atropine sulfate as a treatment for cobra poisoning due to its intensified effects when combined with cobra venom.
